H0.text: Swash is the action that transports sediment deposited on a beach, which may come from a local source.

H1.text: Rip currents are the action that transports sediment to a beach, offering an alternative to sediment deposited from a local source.

H2.text: River currents are the action that can transport sediment deposited on a beach from a local source.

H3.text: Longshore drift is the action that transports sediment deposited on a beach from a local source to other locations.

A4.text: This sediment then enters the coastal system and is transported by longshore drift.
